statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Now here is a matrix with letter 'a','b','c','w','x','y','z' and you can change 'w' to 'a' or 'b', change 'x' to 'b' or 'c', change 'y' to 'a' or 'c', and change 'z' to 'a', 'b' or 'c'. After you changed it, what's the largest submatrix with the same letters you can make?

statement.title: Input
statement.content: The input contains multiple test cases. Each test case begins with m and n (1 �� m, n �� 1000) on line. Then come the elements of a matrix in row-major order on m lines each with n letters. The input ends once EOF is met.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, output one line containing the number of elements of the largest submatrix of all same letters.

statement.title: Source
statement.content: 2009 Multi-University Training Contest 7 - Host by FZU
